titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the National Education Association Web Archives Collection, 2015-2018 NEA1014.RG
titlestmt.author: Special Collections Research Center, The George Washington University

publicationstmt.publisher: Special Collections Research Center, The George Washington University

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2022-05-18 15:07:12 -0400.

repository.corpname: Special Collections Research Center, The George Washington University

did.unittitle: National Education Association Web Archives Collection (Version 3)
did.unitdate: Harvested multiple times between 6 July 2015 and 28 November 2018
did.physloc: Materials are stored on a web-accessible server.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: To the extent that they own copyright, the National Education Association as donor has licensed their materials to be used for non-commercial research, scholarly, or other educational uses. Copyright in other items in this collection may be held by their respective creators. For activities that the researcher determines fall under fair use as defined under U. S. Copyright Law, no permission to cite or publish is required. For re-use of materials in the collection not created by the donor, researchers are responsible for determining who may hold materials' copyrights, determining if the intended re-use falls under fair use, and obtaining approval from the copyright holder if the intended use does not fall under fair use. Researchers do not need anything further from The George Washington University Special Collections Research Center. Please contact Special Collections if the copyright status of the materials you wish to reuse is unclear. Staff will provide additional information.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Please cite unpublished materials in the following way:
Please provide the title and date of item, catalog number (if applicable it will be found written on the folder), name of the collection, name of the repository, and location of the repository.

Example: James Oglethorpe to the Trustees, 13 January 1876, RG0001 Series 1, Box 4, Folder 3. Records of the Board of Trustees, Special Collections Research Center, Gelman Library, The George Washington University, Washington, D.C.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: This collection was harvested and archived through Archive-It

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The following URLs were harvested as part of this collection: edadvocacy.nea.org/archives, neamb.com, neablackcaucus.org, neahispaniccaucus.org, nea-apic.com, teacherleadershipinstitute.org, neawomenscaucus.com, nea-glbtc.org, priorityschools.org, myschoolmyvoice.nea.org, healthyfutures.nea.org, edadvocacy.nea.org, nea.org, neaacademy.org, lilysblackboard.org, educationvotes.nea.org, teacherleadershipinitiative.org, neahealthyfutures.org, neatoday.org, and neamb.com

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: This collection is open for research.

odd.head: Note on Accessibility
odd.p: Patrons should be aware that these websites were archived in their original state and may not meet expectations for accessibility.
